intro: Smyrniopsis aucheri, commonly known as the Persian buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has hairy stems and leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Smyrniopsis aucheri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
